ClipboardChangeEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The ClipboardChangeEvent interface of the {{domxref("Clipboard API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents events fired whenever the contents of the system clipboard are changed.

ClipboardChangeEventChangeId.summary: NOTE Experimental The changeId read-only property of the interface returns an integer representing a unique identifier for this specific clipboard change operation.

remarks.para: The identifier is consistent across all windows and tabs with the same storage key for the same clipboard change, enabling applications to deduplicate events when multiple windows receive the same clipboard change notification.

ClipboardChangeEventChangeId.value: An integer. A cryptographically derived 128-bit integer that, after something is written to the clipboard, is guaranteed to yield a different value than it did before the write operation.

ClipboardChangeEventClipboardChangeEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The ClipboardChangeEvent() constructor creates a new object instance when a clipboardchange event occurs. The clipboardchange event fires whenever the system clipboard contents are changed either by a web app or any other system application.

blockquote.para: This event constructor is generally not needed for production websites. Its primary use is for tests that require an instance of this event.

ClipboardChangeEventTypes.summary: NOTE Experimental The types read-only property of the interface returns an array of strings representing the mandatory {{glossary("MIME type","MIME types")}} available on the system clipboard when the ClipboardChangeEvent event was fired. Optional types and custom formats are not included to limit fingerprinting.
